io.github.trulyfree.modular.event

Interface ModifiableEventGroup<T extends Event>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of Event supported by this EventGroup.
    All Superinterfaces:
    EventGroup<T>

    public interface ModifiableEventGroup<T extends Event>
extends EventGroup<T>
    ModifiableEventGroup interface. Groups of Events which occur with relevancy to each other and may alter in count should be packaged together in a ModifiableEventGroup. Depending on the usage of EventHandlers, it may be efficient to use an implementation shich also implements "Event", by which the "enact" method loops throughout the Events contained within this Event group and enacts them all. Such a method for ModifiableEventGroups is highly suggested to be created with the "synchronous" keyword.
    Author:
    vtcakavsmoace

        enactAll, enactAllOfType, enactNextEvent, getEvents, size

    • Method Detail

      • addEvent

        boolean addEvent(T event)
        Method to be called in order to add an Event to this EventGroup. Implementations which extend existing List implementations should find this method to be a single call.
        Parameters:
        event - The Event to add to the EventGroup.
        Returns:
        success A boolean representing the success of the add operation. Note that if a throwable is thrown by this method, it should be caught and the method return false.

      • removeEvent

        T removeEvent(T event)
        Method to be called in order to remove an Event from this EventGroup. Implementations which extend existing List implementations should find this method to be very simple to implement.
        Parameters:
        event - The Event to remove from the EventGroup.
        Returns:
        removed The Event removed by this operation.

      • removeEventByType

        default Collection<T> removeEventByType(Class<? extends Event> type)
        Method to be called in order to remove Events of a specific type from this EventGroup. A suggested implementation has been provided, but implementations may differ on the approach chosen.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of Event to remove. Note that this should respect polymorphism.
        Returns:
        removed The Event(s) removed by this operation. If no events are removed, this should return an empty collection of Events.

      • clear

        default void clear()
        Method to be called in order to remove all Events from this EventGroup. A suggested implementation has been provided. Implementations may differ according to need.
